text: We must preserve New York’s fusion voting system because it gives more voice to voters. I support the @WorkingFamilies Party’s efforts to protect this system, which gives voters a stronger voice in elections and in government.

As we mark 54 years since Bloody Sunday, it's a disgrace that we are still fighting for the right to vote. We must not only end all forms of voter suppression in this country, we must make it easier for people to vote.

RT @People4Bernie "This campaign is bigger than any one place or region, this is a campaign about uniting the entire country to defeat Donald Trump and to transform this country into the compassionate progressive country we know it can be." Ashley Galvan-Ramos #BernieInChicago http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1102385704766648320/pu/img/DVwrId_w8gn7y1WP.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1102385704766648320/pu/vid/320x180/lRXdP3FTX-79Jdu8.mp4?tag=6
Our democracy is stronger when every voice is represented on the ballot. I support the @WorkingFamilies Party's fight to protect New York's fusion voting system.

Every single Republican I know decried President Obama’s use of executive power to legislate. We were right then. But the only way to be an honest officeholder is to stand up for the same principles no matter who is in power. https://www.foxnews.com/opinion/sen-rand-paul-i-support-president-trump-but-i-cant-support-this-national-emergency-declaration

Today, we honor the bravery and strength of the civil rights leaders who marched across Edmund Pettus Bridge on #BloodySunday. 54 years later, voter suppression is still very real. We must fight to overturn every last voter suppression law that keeps people of color from voting.
America can — and must — meet the challenge of climate change head-on. It’s up to us to do what is necessary to secure a safe, healthy future for generations to come.
